meanings.definition: The technology used to create robots that mimic human or animal movements.
meanings.sent1: The animatronics in the theme park amazed the children with their lifelike movements.
meanings.sent2: The movie used animatronics to bring dinosaurs back to life on the big screen.
meanings.sent3: The animatronics at the museum made the statues seem like they were dancing.
meanings.sent4: The animatronics in the haunted house were so realistic, they gave me chills.
meanings.sent5: The animatronics at the zoo made the animal exhibit interactive and engaging.

meanings.definition: The field of study involving the design and operation of robotic figures.
meanings.sent1: Students interested in animatronics learn how to design and program robotic characters.
meanings.sent2: The animatronics department at the university offers courses in robotics and engineering.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for animatronics made the class both educational and fun.
meanings.sent4: In the world of animatronics, creativity and technical skills go hand in hand.
meanings.sent5: The future of animatronics looks promising with advancements in artificial intelligence.

meanings.definition: The practice of using mechanical devices to animate characters in entertainment.
meanings.sent1: The animatronics industry plays a crucial role in creating immersive experiences for audiences.
meanings.sent2: The theme park invested in state-of-the-art animatronics for their new attraction.
meanings.sent3: The animatronics technician brought the robot to life with intricate movements.
meanings.sent4: The magic show used animatronics to make the illusions even more captivating.
meanings.sent5: The animatronics show at the circus wowed the crowd with its dynamic performances.
